channel.title: Router Assistance and Device Problem
channel.description:
Alright, I'm having a hard time with NETGEAR customer support because we don't have warranty, and frankly don't have a card to hand to them, so we can't get customer support.
So I'm having a problem with the router, and it seems to be not sending out Wi-Fi signals to like the Xbox, Labtop etc., and I've tried a lot of things to see if it would work but seems to not be working...
So does someone have a suggestion? -------------------------------------------------------- I'm having a problem with my music device and it seems to not be working when I plug the cord that goes into the tower of the desktop or my USB port, and then plugging the other end of the USB cable into the music device, it seems to not open up the media files that I need to either add or delete music from.
I've even tried to format it with connecting it to the Xbox, and formatting it into Xbox hardware, but then that didn't even register. So I hooked it up to my desktop, and not even that worked. So I'm asking, what else should I do? I don't know what's wrong, and this device is pretty well new, I've never really used it as much as before though.

item.title: Router Assistance and Device Problem
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

T4_:

Sounds like a shit device.

Nah, it’s a decent device for a MP3. I don’t know what caused this sudden hardware problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Router Assistance and Device Problem
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Ix Soulcist xI, post:8, topic:397403”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=494550.msg3622796#msg3622796 date=1307580865]

I fixed the router situation thanks to a simple solution.

What device is it? Find a manual online and see in Troubleshooting.

I’ve looked for the device, and for some reason it seems to not have a specific name besides stating ‘Etec’ on the device. And I can’t find an official website for this Etec name or at least I’m not searching for the right thing.

Model # is usually located somewhere on the device.
[/quote]
The model number is nowhere located on the device, the only writing on this device is, ‘Etec, Mic, and Digital Media Player’.[/quote]
Sounds like a shit device.

Read full topic

item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

You could try using dd-wrt if your router supports it, it worked for me

Read full topic

item.title: Router Assistance and Device Problem
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

Yeah, I’ve restarted the router and ended up fixing the stupid thing, I don’t even know what happened to be honest, after the storm and restarting the router that night, it went down as far as Wi-Fi goes.

Other than that, this has been fixed.

Does someone know a solution or suggestion towards the second thing I’m having trouble with?

Read full topic

item.title: Router Assistance and Device Problem
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Firstly, have you reset it? (http://vpncasestudy.com/reset.html)

Secondly, what’s your routers model?

http://support.netgear.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/10727/session/L3NpZC9zMkRTRHJ2aw%3D%3D

When you find it, try http://support.netgear.com/app/ it has FAQs etc for your router, this may troubleshoot your problem.

Oh, also, don’t you need to buy an adaptation for the xbox360 in order to go wireless? Even if you’ve fixed this now, you might want to take note of the links there the best free support you’re gonna get.

Other usefull links:

http://support.netgear.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/1066/~/scope-of-netgear’s-free-technical-support

Read full topic
